title: NVDA — Equity Research Report
summary: Deep-dive into NVIDIA's data center dominance and AI accelerator moat. This report analyzes the structural tailwinds driving hyperscaler capex, competitive positioning against AMD and Intel, and the long-term monetization of the CUDA software ecosystem.
thesis: NVIDIA holds an 80%+ share of AI training workloads, protected by an 11-year CUDA developer moat that competitors cannot replicate quickly.
Data center revenue is on track to triple over the next 24 months as hyperscalers (MSFT, GOOGL, AMZN) accelerate GPU procurement ahead of sovereign AI buildouts.
Blackwell architecture represents a step-change in inference efficiency, which expands the total addressable market beyond training into real-time enterprise inference.
At 28x forward EV/EBITDA vs. historical average of 35x, the stock remains undervalued relative to its earnings growth trajectory.

dcfHighlights.model: 3-Stage DCF with explicit 5-year forecast, fade period (years 6-10), and Gordon Growth terminal value.

keyRisks: Export controls restricting China sales (currently ~20% of revenue)
Customer concentration: top 5 hyperscalers = 46% of revenue
Cyclical capex slowdown if AI ROI disappoints enterprise buyers

title: LBO Model — Private Equity Case Study
summary: Full leveraged buyout model for a hypothetical mid-market industrial distribution company. Built from scratch in Excel with integrated three-statement model, debt schedule, and investor return analysis.
thesis: Target company is a $180M revenue industrial distributor with stable EBITDA margins (~14%) and low capex requirements — ideal LBO candidate.
Entry at 7.5x EBITDA with 60/40 debt/equity split. Exit at 8.0x after 5 years via strategic sale.
Operational improvements: pricing optimization and working capital efficiency drive EBITDA expansion from 14% to 17.5% over the hold period.
Base case returns 3.2x MoM / 26% IRR, with downside scenario still generating 2.1x MoM / 16% IRR.

dcfHighlights.model: Full 3-statement LBO model with 5-year projection, debt waterfall, PIK toggle, and sensitivity tables.

keyRisks: Interest rate sensitivity — modeled at 7.5% blended rate on senior secured
Customer concentration in automotive sector (~30% of revenue)
Limited organic growth potential if end markets soften

title: Portfolio Analytics Dashboard
summary: Python-based portfolio analytics tool that pulls live data from Yahoo Finance, calculates risk metrics, and generates a PDF tearsheet. Built with Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, and yfinance.
thesis: Pulls live OHLCV data for any equity or ETF portfolio using the yfinance API, no paid data subscription required.
Calculates rolling Sharpe ratio, max drawdown, beta, VaR (95% historical), and Sortino ratio for each position and the blended portfolio.
Generates a clean 2-page PDF tearsheet using matplotlib and reportlab, formatted to match institutional standards.
Modular architecture makes it easy to plug in alternative data sources or add factor exposure analysis (Fama-French 3-factor).

dcfHighlights.model: Risk engine: VaR, CVaR, Sharpe, Sortino, Beta, Max Drawdown — all computed from daily returns.

keyRisks: yfinance data quality issues for less-liquid securities
